sectionData.Classification: Actinopteri (ray-finned fishes) > Perciformes/Zoarcoidei (Eelpouts and pricklebacks) > Zoarcidae (Eelpouts) > Zoarcinae Etymology: Zoarces: Greek, zoarkes, -es = that gives life (Ref. 45335). More on authors: Bloch & Schneider.
sectionData.Environment: Marine; brackish; demersal; oceanodromous (Ref. 51243); depth range 0 - 388 m (Ref. 58426). Temperate; ? - 10°C (Ref. 35432); 63°N - 37°N, 80°W - 43°W
sectionData.Distribution: Northwest Atlantic: Labrador, Canada to Delaware, USA.
sectionData.Biology: Benthic; feeds on worms, crustaceans, molluscs, sea squirts, sea urchins and fishes (Ref. 58426).
sectionData.Life cycle: Eggs are laid in gelatinous masses guarded by one or both parents until hatching (Ref. 35432). However, more recent evidence suggests that care is provided by the female alone (Ref. 104883).
